        <item>
          <title>The Dare: A week without emojis</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2016/01/12/the-dare-a-week-without-emojis.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">1cc5d24c-a9db-4b0e-a7c1-e9e934e79f96</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Tue, 12 Jan 2016 07:00:00 EST</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2016/01/12/the-dare-a-week-without-emojis/carli-emojis.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Carli Stephens-Rothman ditches the :) and shows some real emotion.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Carli Stephens-Rothman - Special to the Star</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2016/01/12/the-dare-a-week-without-emojis/carli-emojis.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2016/01/12/the-dare-a-week-without-emojis/carli-emojis.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Carli Stephens-Rothman is rethinking that winky face after going a week without using emojis.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Ken Faught</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">For the Toronto Star</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>How I survived my two-week digital diet </title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">a2749dcc-55c3-4227-9a6a-2a4d34656315</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Fri, 13 Nov 2015 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/main-image.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>No Smartphone. No Google. No Twitter. No texting and no music — except for a Walkman.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Ofelia Legaspi - Special to the Star</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/main-image.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/main-image.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Ofelia Legaspi goes two weeks with old technology like the walkman, discman and a point and shoot camera.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Party’s back on if a new source of helium pans out</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/08/27/partys-back-on-if-a-new-source-of-helium-pans-out.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">99f8c6fc-f1ac-4434-a92a-2c6acd2d2bb1</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 27 Aug 2015 17:05:23 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/27/partys-back-on-if-a-new-source-of-helium-pans-out/heartbeat-heliumjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Used in balloons and industry, gas is hard to capture and supplies are diminishing and its price rising. Researchers think it may be found under ground.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/27/partys-back-on-if-a-new-source-of-helium-pans-out/heartbeat-heliumjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/27/partys-back-on-if-a-new-source-of-helium-pans-out/heartbeat-heliumjpg.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Helium, the gas that fills balloons, is in short supply. It has industrial uses and the price has been increasing.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Frank Augstein</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>YouTube prank sparks discussion of online teen safety</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/08/19/youtube-prank-sparks-discussion-of-online-teen-safety.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">4866facf-c40e-454b-a37c-e219aab551f5</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Wed, 19 Aug 2015 17:21:43 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/19/youtube-prank-sparks-discussion-of-online-teen-safety/childluring.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Coby Persin, whose YouTube channel is known for prank videos with a touch of social commentary, tricked teenage girls he met online to meet him in person.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/19/youtube-prank-sparks-discussion-of-online-teen-safety/childluring.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/19/youtube-prank-sparks-discussion-of-online-teen-safety/childluring.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>According to a digital literacy organization, online predators are a rare, but real threat. About six per cent of all cybercrime reported to the police involved internet child luring, or just about 86 cases, according to 2012 Stats Canada data.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">YouTube</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>When it comes to climate change not all opinions are valid, scientists say </title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/06/23/when-it-comes-to-climate-change-not-all-opinions-are-valid-scientists-say.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">7219a941-e54c-4314-b318-e6418af1fd47</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Tue, 23 Jun 2015 20:25:00 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/23/when-it-comes-to-climate-change-not-all-opinions-are-valid-scientists-say/lodebate05.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>While featuring all sides of an issue is a hallmark of good journalism, many in the scientific community feel that the media should do a better job of separating facts from opinions. 
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/23/when-it-comes-to-climate-change-not-all-opinions-are-valid-scientists-say/lodebate05.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/23/when-it-comes-to-climate-change-not-all-opinions-are-valid-scientists-say/lodebate05.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The Green Party's Elizabeth May (left)  and Lord Nigel Dawson (right) debate climate change in a Munk debate. There is a fine line between being a critic and a quack when it comes to climate change, say both scientists and journalists.

</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Lucas Oleniuk</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Cat clings to wing of plane during flight</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">cabd61f4-52e8-41c4-810c-53e9aa6b1302</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Mon, 22 Jun 2015 15:04:59 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/planecat.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>A stowaway cat shocked small-plane pilot and passenger.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/planecat.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/planecat.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>This stowaway cat gave one pilot the fright of his life as it emerged on top of the wing of an Ultralight plane and stuck its head into the cockpit.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Romain Jantot</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">YouTube</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/piperthecat.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/piperthecat.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Piper the cat is the "longest running employee" at Canadian Flyers at Markham Airport.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">Submitted photo</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>10 words that just got added to the Merriam-Webster dictionary</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/05/26/10-words-that-just-got-added-to-the-miriam-webster-dictionary.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">dc15185b-02c3-4673-9948-9f5692dd932b</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Tue, 26 May 2015 15:57:04 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/05/26/10-words-that-just-got-added-to-the-miriam-webster-dictionary/chilaquiles.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>The dictionary has added more than 1,700 entries.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            thestar.com</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/05/26/10-words-that-just-got-added-to-the-miriam-webster-dictionary/chilaquiles.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/05/26/10-words-that-just-got-added-to-the-miriam-webster-dictionary/chilaquiles.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Chilaquiles, a Mexican dish, has been added to the Merriam-Webster dictionary.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>The 5 best grocery stores in Toronto to find your soul mate </title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/05/20/the-5-best-grocery-stores-in-toronto-to-find-your-soul-mate.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">cf7972dc-2fad-4be1-ac8b-f97804abf9fd</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Wed, 20 May 2015 17:51:02 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/05/20/the-5-best-grocery-stores-in-toronto-to-find-your-soul-mate/loblaws-maple-leafs.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>If you’re lucky, you’ll find something besides avocados to squeeze in these grocery stores.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/05/20/the-5-best-grocery-stores-in-toronto-to-find-your-soul-mate/loblaws-maple-leafs.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/05/20/the-5-best-grocery-stores-in-toronto-to-find-your-soul-mate/loblaws-maple-leafs.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Looking for love? Loblaws at Maple Leaf Gardens offers a great selection of young working professionals....</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Tom Sandler</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>How-old.net guesses your age at your own peril</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">a8d5b120-be22-4b2f-a8d9-09fa853a3fdb</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 30 Apr 2015 17:41:17 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/bieberjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>The insult-triggering website was built by Microsoft as an exercise in machine learning.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/bieberjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/bieberjpg.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The site guessed Justin Bieber is 22. He's actually 21.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/toryjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/toryjpg.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The site guessed John Tory is 56, he's actually 60.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/wallinjpg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/wallinjpg.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The tool estimates suspended senator Pamela Wallin is 87. She's 62.  
</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Has Earth entered the anthropocene epoch?</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/04/14/has-earth-entered-the-anthropocene-epoch.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">8bae6f1c-6460-43ec-90b1-a60d3e69add5</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Tue, 14 Apr 2015 16:08:34 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/has-earth-entered-the-anthropocene-epoch/trinity.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Two recent papers argue over when the anthropocene began and if it should become an official geological time period.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/has-earth-entered-the-anthropocene-epoch/trinity.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/has-earth-entered-the-anthropocene-epoch/trinity.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Did the anthropocene epoch start here? Visitors assemble, April 4, 2015, at the White Sands Missile Range newly opened Trinity Site for an open house commemorating the 70th anniversary of the first atomic test there on July 16, 1945.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Jett Loe</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Facebook still teens’ most-used website: report</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">52f7e7fe-fa33-413b-9d7f-28962d0edba1</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Tue, 14 Apr 2015 16:00:27 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/mark-zuckerberg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>In the U.S. almost three quarters use it, along with others such as Instagram and Snapchat. Twenty-four per cent say they’re online almost constantly.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Leanne Italie - The Associated Press</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/mark-zuckerberg.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/mark-zuckerberg.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Facebook creator Mark Zuckerberg in one of his hoodies. Facebook remains the most used social media site among American teens ages 13 to 17, according to a new study from the Pew Research Center.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Jeff Chiu</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/facebook-on-smartphone.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/facebook-on-smartphone.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Facebook app icons on an iPhone.  Use of social media sites is being aided hugely by smartphones and other mobile devices, with a majority of teens using more than one social network.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">Karly Domb Sadof</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>The newest way to check the time: on your wrist</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/03/18/the-newest-way-to-check-the-time-on-your-wrist.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">6fecc1c2-aa05-4436-9ed8-b40d5fb8fdb8</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Wed, 18 Mar 2015 17:00:00 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/03/18/the-newest-way-to-check-the-time-on-your-wrist/baselworld2014watchface.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>At the posh watch show Baselworld, the talk will be about Apple’s entry into the market.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Nancy J. White - Living Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/03/18/the-newest-way-to-check-the-time-on-your-wrist/baselworld2014watchface.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/03/18/the-newest-way-to-check-the-time-on-your-wrist/baselworld2014watchface.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description></media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/03/18/the-newest-way-to-check-the-time-on-your-wrist/apple-watch.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/03/18/the-newest-way-to-check-the-time-on-your-wrist/apple-watch.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>The Apple Watch goes on sale in April.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>

        <item>
          <title>Hello Barbie: Internet connection the latest trend in toys </title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">5a2a8615-b756-4030-9c51-bdcd8b246e2b</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Tue, 17 Feb 2015 17:55:06 EST</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/hellobarbie2.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>New version of the classic doll, which can chat with children, makes her debut at New York Toy Fair.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Laura Armstrong - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/hellobarbie2.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/hellobarbie2.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Hello Barbie, an internet-connected doll kids can have conversations with, was named one of Popular Sciences Top 10 Gadgets and Gizmos at the New York Toy Fair.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">handout</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/cognitoys.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/cognitoys.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description> The CogniToys dinosaur, which is in part funded by a Kickstarter campaign, is just one of the internet-connected toys showcased at the New York Toy Fair.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">handout</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Reposting your first profile picture is the latest Facebook craze</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/01/15/reposting-your-first-profile-picture-is-the-latest-facebook-craze.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">a2f0d75d-3fb4-4714-a381-8c96238d6a8c</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 15 Jan 2015 17:00:00 EST</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/01/15/reposting-your-first-profile-picture-is-the-latest-facebook-craze/facebook.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Essentially, you surface your first-ever Facebook profile picture — and then nominate three friends to do the same.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Caitlin Dewey - The Washington Post</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/01/15/reposting-your-first-profile-picture-is-the-latest-facebook-craze/facebook.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/01/15/reposting-your-first-profile-picture-is-the-latest-facebook-craze/facebook.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Facebook is abuzz with a new game: Post your first-ever Facebook profile picture — and then nominate your friends to do the same.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author">BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI</media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">AFP/GETTY IMAGES</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Toronto man looking for Elizabeth Gallagher inspires new ticket-sharing website</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2014/11/10/toronto_man_looking_for_elizabeth_gallagher_inspires_new_ticketsharing_website.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">75678bf7-07a7-4f4c-b8f2-0d20ccb0d2e3</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Mon, 10 Nov 2014 18:49:08 EST</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/11/10/toronto_man_looking_for_elizabeth_gallagher_inspires_new_ticketsharing_website/jordan_axani.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Connections allows users to post spare plane tickets and the name of the person the ticket is registered to in hopes of finding a traveler with the same name. 
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Tara Deschamps - Staff Reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/11/10/toronto_man_looking_for_elizabeth_gallagher_inspires_new_ticketsharing_website/jordan_axani.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/11/10/toronto_man_looking_for_elizabeth_gallagher_inspires_new_ticketsharing_website/jordan_axani.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>Jordan Axani planned a trip with his girlfriend name Elizabeth Gallagher, but they split. He offered his ex's tickets to any woman with her name and a Canadian passport. Now, another Toronto man has created a website where people can post spare plane tickets with the name of the person the ticket is registered in the hope that the ticket can be used.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">THE ASSOCIATED PRESS</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>YouTube stars get screen time at Buffer Festival</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2014/10/16/youtube_stars_get_screen_time_at_buffer_festival.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">c1d622b9-0271-4502-b493-fa0ea3ba7e72</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Thu, 16 Oct 2014 20:27:52 EDT</pubDate>
          <description>
          
          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/youtube_stars_get_screen_time_at_buffer_festival/matt_santoro.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Matt Santoro is one of numerous Canadian YouTube celebrities who will be in town for the second annual event.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Barbara Turnbull - Living reporter</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/youtube_stars_get_screen_time_at_buffer_festival/matt_santoro.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">
	              <media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/youtube_stars_get_screen_time_at_buffer_festival/matt_santoro.jpg.size.xsmall.original.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	              <media:description>St. Catharines resident Matt Santoro makes a comfortable living from his 2.75 million YouTube subscribers, who tune in to watch his weekly Top 10 lists. Santoro appears at Toronto's Buffer Festival, taking place Oct. 17 to 19.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>
    
        <item>
          <title>Gamergate: Videogame industry speaks out against harassment</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2014/10/16/gamergate_videogame_industry_speaks_out_against_harassment.html</link>

          <pubDate>Thu, 16 Oct 2014 14:57:00 EDT</pubDate>

          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/gamergate_videogame_industry_speaks_out_against_harassment/call_of_duty.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>‘Gamergate’ controversy shines spotlight on the ugliest part of gaming culture.
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Hayley Tsukayama - The Washington Post</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/gamergate_videogame_industry_speaks_out_against_harassment/call_of_duty.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">

	              <media:description>Rightly or wrongly, videogames like the Call of Duty series (pictured) have been blamed for fostering a violent culture.</media:description>
	              <media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	              
	              <media:credit role="owner">MCT</media:credit>
	              
	            </media:content>
	            

        
        

        
        

        
        
        </item>

        <item>
          <title>Kobo launches waterproof e-reader</title>
          <link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2014/08/26/kobo_launches_waterproof_ereader.html</link>
          <guid isPermaLink="false">6fc3d7e9-9245-4022-bb06-443d7b1cde77</guid>
          
          <pubDate>Tue, 26 Aug 2014 19:00:00 EDT</pubDate>

          	<img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/08/26/kobo_launches_waterproof_ereader/kobo_aura_h2o.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg"/><br/>Latest iteration of the electronic library can be taken to the beach or into the bath. 
          
          </description>

          
          
          <author>
            Deborah Dundas - Books</author>
            

       
	            <media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/08/26/kobo_launches_waterproof_ereader/kobo_aura_h2o.jpg.size.xxlarge.original.jpg" medium="image">

	              <media:description>The Kobo Aura H20 is touted as being waterproof in a metre of water up to 30 minutes and with dustproof and antiglare design.</media:description>

	            </media:content>
